review: Setting it up was a lesson in frustration. I followed the instructions, no go. Googled how to set it up, followed several people's suggestions, no go. No matter what I did at the very last it would tell me that it could not find the network. Finally figured it out. During the install, your wireless device, I was using a laptop, will be connected to the Chromecast as if it's a network. You have to go in and connect back to your "home" network. After that it worked like a champ, with some limitations. If you are using one of the support sites, like Netflix and Google Chrome it works great. But, if you try and cast a video playing in Chrome (I download a lot of videos, all legally of course) it's very hit or miss. Another little bugaboo, once you start casting, it actually no longer uses the device, like a laptop, it connects straight to your wireless router. You could turn your laptop off and it would keep playing the video. And that's the problem. It's hard, to the point of ridiculous, to control the playback. One night we simply could not get control and had to boot the router to get it to stop. If you leave the laptop open and the video playing, it's okay, but it seems silly to have it playing on your monitor and TV.
